eclipse.buildId=I20060419-1640
java.version=1.5.0_06
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=sv_SE
Command-line arguments:  -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86

When accessing project properties on a new created project (or an old for that matter) Eclipse gets an error complaining about invalid value, and in the log there is an ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException.

Further investigation reveals that the error disappears if I change the reghional settings in Windows from Swedish to US-English, and that it is the date formatting that is the problem:
US Date: "April 23, 2006 7:09:44 PM"
Swedish Date: "den 23 april 2006 19:23:03"

I just ran into a similar problem when using the Update Manager. If I don't start Eclipse 3.2RC1 with LC_ALL=en_US (to override my sv_SE setting) I get the following when (for example) searching for new features to install:

java.lang.ExceptionInInitializerError
at org.eclipse.update.internal.core.SiteURLFactory.createSite(SiteURLFactory.java:93)

eclipse.buildId=I20060419-1640
java.version=1.5.0_06
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=linux, ARCH=x86, WS=gtk, NL=sv_SE
Command-line arguments:  -os linux -ws gtk -arch x86
More ICU stuff, a dup perhaps?
I think this is a dup of bug 134690.  Can you try a nightly build > N20060420-0010?
The build you are using has ICU v 3.4.3 - this problem should be fixed in ICU 3.4.4 which is in the nightly builds, but not in the integration builds yet.

I think this bug is fixed (and likely a dup of bug 134690) because in build N20060425-0010 when running in Swedish locale and bringing up the property dialog, Eclipse crashes!  See bug 138243. 

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 134690 ***
Now if you try to launch a debug session you will get the problem in bug 138243

Accidentally re-opened the bug.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 134690 ***
